title: Settings
description: Manage application settings and user preferences
subtitle: Manage application settings and user preferences
publicCsvExportDescription: Allow public access to download event calendar as CSV file
publicCsvExportDesc: Allow public access to download event calendar as CSV file
fileUploadsDescription: Allow stakeholders to upload files (images, PDFs, ZIP) as attachments to task comments. Disable if you consider it a security risk.
fileUploadsDesc: Allow stakeholders to upload files (images, PDFs, ZIP) as attachments to task comments. Disable if you consider it a security risk.
scrapedEventsDescription: Display events automatically imported from external sources (Abu Dhabi Media Office, etc.) alongside manually created events. Disable to hide all scraped events.
scrapedEventsDesc: Display events automatically imported from external sources (Abu Dhabi Media Office, etc.) alongside manually created events. Disable to hide all scraped events.
archiveEnabledDescription: Hide the archive experience entirely. When disabled, archive pages and links are inaccessible to everyone.
changePasswordDialogDescription: Enter your current password and choose a new password
createAdminUserDescription: Add a new admin or superadmin account
createAdminUserDialogDescription: Create a new admin or superadmin user account
adminRoleDescription: Can create, edit, and delete events only
passwordChangedSuccess: Your password has been changed successfully
userCreatedSuccess: The admin user has been created successfully
sampleDataDescription: Load or reset the curated departments, tasks, and events used for demos. Runs immediately on production data.
seedSampleDataSuccess: Demo data has been loaded successfully
resetSampleDataSuccess: Demo data has been cleared successfully
sampleDataActionError: Failed to process sample data action
seedSampleDataConfirmDescription: This will immediately create the departments, tasks, reminders, and events used for demos. Continue?
resetSampleDataConfirmDescription: This will remove the demo departments, tasks, and events created by the seeding script.
